Package: com.android.build.gradle.internal

[Java] Class TaskManager

    • com.android.build.gradle.internal.TaskManager

    • Manages tasks creation.

        • public AndroidTask<org.gradle.api.tasks.compile.JavaCompile> createJavacTask(@com.android.annotations.NonNull TaskFactory tasks, @com.android.annotations.NonNull VariantScope scope)

          Creates the task for creating *.class files using javac. These tasks are created regardless of whether Jack is used or not, but assemble will not depend on them if it is. They are always used when running unit tests.

        • public void createLintTasks(TaskFactory tasks, VariantScope scope)

          Add tasks for running lint on individual variants. We've already added a lint task earlier which runs on all variants.

        • public void createMergeAppManifestsTask(@com.android.annotations.NonNull TaskFactory tasks, @com.android.annotations.NonNull VariantScope variantScope)

        • public void createMergeAssetsTask(TaskFactory tasks, VariantScope scope)

        • public void createMockableJarTask()

        • public void createNdkTasks(@com.android.annotations.NonNull VariantScope scope)

        • public void createPackagingTask(@com.android.annotations.NonNull TaskFactory tasks, @com.android.annotations.NonNull VariantScope variantScope, boolean publishApk)

          Creates the final packaging task, and optionally the zipalign task (if the variant is signed)

          Parameters:
          publishApk - if true the generated APK gets published.

        • public void createPostCompilationTasks(TaskFactory tasks, @com.android.annotations.NonNull VariantScope scope)

          Creates the post-compilation tasks for the given Variant. These tasks create the dex file from the .class files, plus optional intermediary steps like proguard and jacoco

        • public void createPreprocessResourcesTask(@com.android.annotations.NonNull TaskFactory tasks, @com.android.annotations.NonNull VariantScope scope)

        • public void createProcessJavaResTask(@com.android.annotations.NonNull TaskFactory tasks, @com.android.annotations.NonNull VariantScope scope)

        • public void createProcessResTask(@com.android.annotations.NonNull TaskFactory tasks, @com.android.annotations.NonNull VariantScope scope, boolean generateResourcePackage)

        • public void createProcessResTask(@com.android.annotations.NonNull TaskFactory tasks, @com.android.annotations.NonNull VariantScope scope, @com.android.annotations.Nullable File symbolLocation, boolean generateResourcePackage)

        • protected void createProcessTestManifestTask(@com.android.annotations.NonNull TaskFactory tasks, @com.android.annotations.NonNull VariantScope scope)

        • public void createRenderscriptTask(@com.android.annotations.NonNull TaskFactory tasks, @com.android.annotations.NonNull VariantScope scope)

        • public void createReportTasks(List<BaseVariantData<? extends BaseVariantOutputData>> variantDataList)

        • public void createSplitAbiTasks(@com.android.annotations.NonNull VariantScope scope)

        • public void createSplitResourcesTasks(@com.android.annotations.NonNull VariantScope scope)

          Creates the split resources packages task if necessary. AAPT will produce split packages for all --split provided parameters. These split packages should be signed and moved unchanged to the APK build output directory.

        • public void createTasksBeforeEvaluate(@com.android.annotations.NonNull TaskFactory tasks)

          Create tasks before the evaluation (on plugin apply). This is useful for tasks that could be referenced by custom build logic.

        • public void createTasksForVariantData(@com.android.annotations.NonNull TaskFactory tasks, @com.android.annotations.NonNull BaseVariantData<? extends BaseVariantOutputData> variantData)

          Creates the tasks for a given BaseVariantData.

        • public void createTopLevelTestTasks(TaskFactory tasks, boolean hasFlavors)

        • public void createUnitTestVariantTasks(@com.android.annotations.NonNull TaskFactory tasks, @com.android.annotations.NonNull TestVariantData variantData)

          Creates the tasks to build unit tests.

        • @com.android.annotations.NonNull public ZipAlign createZipAlignTask(@com.android.annotations.NonNull String name, @com.android.annotations.NonNull File inputFile, @com.android.annotations.NonNull File outputFile)

          creates a zip align. This does not use convention mapping, and is meant to let other plugin create zip align tasks.

          Parameters:
          name - the name of the task
          inputFile - the input file
          outputFile - the output file
          Returns:
          the task

        • @com.android.annotations.NonNull protected AndroidTaskRegistry getAndroidTasks()

        • protected AndroidConfig getExtension()

        • public GlobalScope getGlobalScope()

        • public org.gradle.api.tasks.Copy getJacocoAgentTask()

        • @com.android.annotations.NonNull public Set<File> getJniFolders(@com.android.annotations.NonNull VariantScope scope)

          Calculate the list of folders that can contain jni artifacts for this variant.

          Returns:
          a potentially empty list of directories that exist or not and that may contains native resources.

        • @com.android.annotations.NonNull protected org.gradle.api.logging.Logger getLogger()

        • protected Collection<Object> getNdkBuildable(BaseVariantData variantData)

          Returns a collection of buildables that creates native object. A buildable is considered to be any object that can be used as the argument to Task.dependsOn. This could be a Task or a BuildableModelElement (e.g. BinarySpec).

        • @com.android.annotations.Nullable public File maybeCreateProguardTasks(@com.android.annotations.NonNull TaskFactory tasks, @com.android.annotations.NonNull VariantScope scope, @com.android.annotations.NonNull PostCompilationData pcData)

          Creates the proguarding task for the given Variant if necessary.

          Returns:
          null if the proguard task was not created, otherwise the expected outputFile.

        • public static void optionalDependsOn(@com.android.annotations.NonNull org.gradle.api.Task main, org.gradle.api.Task... dependencies)

        • public static void optionalDependsOn(@com.android.annotations.NonNull org.gradle.api.Task main, @com.android.annotations.NonNull List<?> dependencies)

        • public void resolveDependencies(@com.android.annotations.NonNull VariantDependencies variantDeps, @com.android.annotations.Nullable VariantDependencies testedVariantDeps, @com.android.annotations.Nullable String testedProjectPath)

        • public static void setJavaCompilerTask(@com.android.annotations.NonNull AndroidTask<? extends org.gradle.api.tasks.compile.AbstractCompile> javaCompilerTask, @com.android.annotations.NonNull TaskFactory tasks, @com.android.annotations.NonNull VariantScope scope)

          Makes the given task the one used by top-level "compile" task.
